reactor.tcp

Class TcpClient<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.tcp.TcpClient<IN,OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - The type that will be received by this client
    OUT - The type that will be sent by this client
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NettyTcpClient

    public abstract class TcpClient<IN,OUT>
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class for a Reactor-based TCP client.

      • open

        public abstract reactor.core.composable.Promise<TcpConnection<IN,OUT>> open()
        Open a TcpConnection to the configured host:port and return a Promise that will be fulfilled when the client is connected.
        Returns:
        A Promise that will be filled with the TcpConnection when connected.

      • open

        public abstract reactor.core.composable.Stream<TcpConnection<IN,OUT>> open(Reconnect reconnect)
        Open a TcpConnection to the configured host:port and return a Stream that will be passed a new TcpConnection object every time the client is connected to the endpoint. The given Reconnect describes how the client should attempt to reconnect to the host if the initial connection fails or if the client successfully connects but at some point in the future gets cut off from the host. The Reconnect tells the client where to try reconnecting and gives a delay describing how long to wait to attempt to reconnect. When the connect is successfully made, the Stream is sent a new TcpConnection backed by the newly-connected connection.
        Parameters:
        reconnect -
        Returns:

      • close

        public reactor.core.composable.Promise<java.lang.Void> close()
        Close any open connections and disconnect this client.
        Returns:
        A Promise that will be fulfilled with null when the connections have been closed.
